title: Introduction
text:
Welcome to R for MSBA!
This is a 2-half-day course designed to prepare you with the R skills that you will need to begin the GW Master of Science in Business Analytics program.
To maximize your learning in this course,


Instructor
Dan Kerchner

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Importing and Exporting Data
text:
Write code to read in a file from a file named mydata.csv located in your project’s data folder.


Solution

# Read a CSV file
data <- read.csv("data/mydata.csv")
head(data)

title: Functions
text:
R can be described as primarily (but not entirely) a “functional” programming language. Most of what you will typically do in R involves using functions, and that is the usual style of R coding. Functional programming can also be a good way to approach data analysis.








At the Console, you can type ? followed by the name of the function (with no space in between) to bring up the help documentation for a function. For example, ?mean will bring up the help page for the mean function.

title: About
text:
# Read a CSV file
data <- read.csv("data/my_data.csv")
head(data)

title: Beginning a Project
text:
I cannot emphasize this enough. RStudio projects allow you to keep each project separate from your other projects.



Your project has its own folder, so your files don’t mix with other projects.
Another benefit
